snippet: Gustavo Arellano, a journalist and Orange County native, is perhaps the greatest (and only) living scholar of Mexican-American fast food.
abstract: Gustavo Arellano, a journalist and Orange County native, is perhaps the greatest, and only, living scholar of Mexican-American fast food; he has just published Taco USA an absorbing account of how a few foods, like salsa, tacos, chili and tequila, from the complicated and enormous cuisine of Mexico, managed to slip into the mainstream of American taste.
lead_paragraph: Gustavo Arellano, a journalist and Orange County native, is perhaps the greatest (and only) living scholar of Mexican-American fast food.

headline.seo: North of the Border, It’s Everyone’s Mexican Food
headline.main: How the Taco Gained in Translation
headline.print_headline: How the Taco Gained in Translation
